title: Dorset and Hampshire Live: Monday 24 April - BBC News
summary: lymington hos manager 'stole from the dying ' .
charity walker rescued after cliff fall on isle of wight .

documents.title: good evening !
text: the bbc local live service for hampshire , dorset and the isle of wight will resume at 08:00 on tuesday .
you can still get in touch by email , via our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset .
thanks for joining us !

documents.title: weather outlook : cold and frosty
text: cloud and patchy light rain this evening will die away with most places becoming dry and clear overnight , allowing a widespread frost to form .
winds will become light in most places .
it 'll be a bright , chilly start tomorrow .
a dry morning will follow with sunny spells , but showers will develop later .
it will also feel cold in sometimes brisk northerly winds .
for a full 10-day forecast , visit the bbc weather site .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: marathon triumph for isle of wight runner victoria coles
text: victoria completes london marathon despite cancer battle

documents.title: firefighters offering keep fit classes
text: hampshire firefighters will soon be offering exercise classes for the over-65s .
the 12-week course in portsmouth is designed to build confidence , reduce the risk of falls , and be a social activity .
the course will be funded by the local nhs .

documents.title: buses banned from bournemouth 'shared space '
text: buses barred from shared space during repair works

documents.title: drone footage of cliff fall coastline
text: drone footage shows the area where a charity walker was rescued after falling in woodland on the isle of wight on sunday afternoon .
the walker was a member of the armed forces raising money for help for heroes and was found in woodland near east cowes on the isle of wight .
she was rescued by ambulance , coastguard and rnli crews and was taken to hospital with suffered hip , neck and back injuries .

documents.title: travel latest : south west trains delays
text: # disruptionswt due to a very high volume of tweets , please see core messages using the above hash tag for updates on travel this evening .
if you check 'tweets and replies ' you will see the most recent responses .
^sc
you have n't replied to anyone though .
not even tried .
you 've just shut up shop @ twitterid
very done swt passengers waiting at wimbledon for shepperton train and you run it through non stop on the fenced off platform great service
# disruptionswt update - services are beginning to be restored , however delays and alterations are still expected until further notice .
is there a better chance of getting to woking if i get district line out to wimbledon ?
guard just said delays of 60 minutes because of a trespasser on the track ? ?
is that true
thanks for the updates .
fingers crossed for getting home .
hope the driver is ok .
# disruptionswt due to emergency services dealing with an incident between waterloo and clapham junction , all lines are currently blocked .
what 's the latest on this please ?
some lines are being reopened , but due to a complete line blockage earlier delays are still being experienced .
^bv
is the 16:31 train from virginia water likely to be subjected to a delay/cancellation ?
at the moment delays are still to be expected .
^bv
can you tell me if there r still severe delays from waterloo towards staines ? last up date i saw was from a few hours ago
hello yvette , yes there are still delays on this line , are you looking to travel soon ?
^sc
please do not use abusive language on our feed .
^sc
i 'm trying get home on the 20:20 to woking .
have you a departure time ?
hi mamapanda , your train should be on the move now ?
^jr
with all the troubles for your line today i can only say thank you .
i 'm nearly home .
much appreciated
i was on the train that was involved in the incident at queenstown road .
lots of emergency services .
it 's going to be a while
i was , too .
# feelsterribleman
someone has commuted suicide , put your personal feelings aside about this incident for gods sake .
your going to be late accept it
thoughts with the crew at this time , especially the driver .
if you told people the reason behind why emergency services are involved they may have some compassion .
being vague does n't help anyone
actually the stats show that it 's had zero impact .
i know it came from the samaritans but it 's just not worked .
not pleasant i know

documents.title: romeu 'not far off ' kante - puel
text: romeu 'not far off ' kante - puel

documents.title: southampton marathon : le tissier completes 10k
text: former saints star matthew le tissier joined the thousands of runners pounding the streets of southampton on sunday .
he completed the 10k race .
the city was also hosting a half marathon and its first full marathon in 30 years .

documents.title: cannabis worth £ 164k found on small boat
text: more than £ 150,000 worth of cannabis has been seized from a `` small boat '' by customs in jersey .
three men , from blandford in dorset , farnham in surrey , and ringwood in hampshire , were arrested arriving into st ouen 's bay ( in the early hours of friday .
a total of 27.6kg ( 59lbs ) of cannabis was seized , with an estimated street value of £ 164,000 .
the men were charged with drug-trafficking offences and the case has been adjourned to 5 june at the royal court .

documents.title: man jailed for portsmouth street stabbing
text: a man who attempted to murder his brother 's partner by stabbing her in the back with a kitchen knife in a busy street has been jailed for a total of 23 years .
dler fariq mohammed had been found guilty of the attempted murder of diana pranskuniene , 35 , who he attacked in london road , portsmouth in july 2016 .
the trial heard mohammed , of no fixed address , was unhappy about being denied access to his five children , who were being cared for by his brother and ms pranskuniene .
on the day of the attack , he shouted , `` you have ruined my life '' , before plunging the blade into his victim 's back and running off .

documents.title: breaking'head-butting ' police sergeant fined
text: a police sergeant who head-butted a woman while wearing a motorcycle helmet in a `` road rage '' attack has been fined .
david sanderson was off-duty when he confronted two women in the car ahead of him at a petrol station in chandler 's ford on 6 june last year .

worthing magistrates ' court heard the 45-year-old was concerned the women were using a mobile phone , before he revved his motorcycle engine and tried to undertake the car they were in as it moved off the forecourt .
passenger donya bryant got out and confronted sanderson who then head-butted her , leaving her with a `` red mark the size of a 50p piece and a swollen lump '' on her forehead , the court was told .
sanderson had denied the offence of assault by beating and was found guilty following a trial last month .
he was fined £ 828 .

documents.title: winchester guildhall clock strikes again
text: winchester 's guildhall clock has begun chiming again after work to repair its 50-year-old mechanism .

documents.title: hos manager 'stole from the dying '
text: hos manager 'stole from the dying '

documents.title: pedestrian injured in bournemouth crash now critically ill
text: a man who was injured when he was struck by a lorry in bournemouth has become critically ill .
the 66-year-old pedestrian was knocked down on holdenhurst road on 19 april .
police said his condition had subsequently deteriorated and he has been transferred to southampton general hospital where he remains in a life-threatening condition .
the injured man has sadly taken a turn for the worse .

there were a number of pedestrians and vehicles in the area at the time of the incident and i would ask anyone who witnessed the collision and has yet to speak to officers to please contact dorset police .

documents.title: watch yourself finish # getinspired
text: if you took part in the london marathon yesterday , massive congratulations - we hope you 're not aching too much today .
you can watch highlights of the day here .
and , if your time was between 2hrs 30mins and 6hrs , you can see yourself finish with this special feed on iplayer .

documents.title: parnham house fire : aerial footage shows extent of damage
text: aerial footage shows the extent of damage to parnham house near beaminister following the devastaing fire earlier this month .
fire crews were called to the grade i-listed elizabethan building in the early hours of 15 april .
a 68-year-old man arrested following hte blaze has been released under investigation .
author: Simon Clemison
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: specialists set to examine parnham house after fire
text: specialist conservation teams say they want to gain access to the 16th century parnham house near beaminster which was gutted by fire in order to check the building will stay standing .
conservationists from historic england hope to be on site in the coming days and believe the house can be returned to its former glory .
the elizabehan building was severely damaged by an overnight fire on 15 april .
on friday , dorset police said a 68-year-old local man arrested following the blaze has been released under investigation .
after a fire has spread through a building , often the structure will have completely been consumed and this leaves external walls and features like chimneys and gables very vulnerable .
the other thing to be aware of is the level of water penetration which will have occurred .
this will have weakened the structure considerable .

documents.title: mayflower theatre launches auditorium appeal
text: the mayflower theatre has launched an appeal to help fund a £ 3.9m refurbishment of it 's grade ii listed auditorium .
so far the theatre has secured £ 2.54m towards the cost of the project , but needs to raise the remaining £ 1.36m .
plans include repainting the auditorium , moving the orchestra pit and installing new seating in the stalls and circle .
the theatre is due to close for the work to be completed in summer 2018 , in time for the 90th anniversray of its opening in december 1928 .
this work is essential not just to preserve the building , but to benefit the more than 500,000 people each year who enjoy visiting our theatre .
it will provide higher levels of comfort , better access and more opportunities to experience live performance in southampton .

documents.title: oakhaven hos manager 's 'grave breach of trust ' over fraud
text: a former hos manager committed a `` grave breach of trust '' when he stole more than £ 13,000 of donations , southampton crown court has heard .
simon plummer , from widden close in sway , pleaded guilty at an earlier hearing to fraud by abuse of position .
he has since repaid the money in full and written to the oakhaven hos to apologise .
he was given an 18-month sentence , suspended for two years .
oakhaven offers palliative and end of life care to people in the new forest area , both at its purpose-built hos and in the community .
it costs about £ 4m a year to run - it receives £ 440,000 from the nhs with the remainder coming from donations , legacies and fundraising .

you deserve to feel shameful as what you have done is steal from the terminally ill. oakhaven is a well-respected local hos which needs all the money it can raise and you have taken that money from them .
what you did was a grave breach of trust and you were at the head if it .
if you had not paid that money back i would be sending you to prison .

documents.title: titanic fur coat sells for £ 150,000
text: a fur coat worn by a stewardess when the titanic sank has been sold at auction for £ 150,000 , almost double its original valuation of £ 80,000 .
mabel bennett grabbed the garment for protection from the elements , as she was wearing a nightdress when the ill-fated ship struck an iceberg on its maiden voyage from southampton in 1912 .
auctioneer andrew aldridge , who sold it on saturday , said the garment was `` one of the most visual lots '' to go on sale in recent years .

documents.title: chelsea v southampton : claude puel press conference
text: speaking at his press conference ahead of southampton clash with chelsea tomorrow , claude puel said striker charlie austin and left-back matt targett will both return to training this week .
and asked about n'golo kante winning the pfa award , puel said : `` n'golo kante brings the same qualities as oriol romeu for us .
for me , oriol is not far off .
he is very consistent . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: breakingoakhaven hos finance manager given suspended sentence for fraud .
text: a former hos finance manager has been given a suspended sentence after admitting stealing more than £ 13,000 of charity donations .
simon plummer , 41 , from widden close in sway , took cash and cheque donations while he worked at oakhaven hos in lymington .
southampton crown court heard he used the money to pay for building work on his own home .

documents.title: women 'emotionally scarred ' by homophobic attack in portsmouth
text: five women who were attacked by a group of men in `` a brutal , homophobic attack '' after a night out in portsmouth say it has left them `` emotionally scarred '' and afraid to go out alone .
the victims , who were in a group of eight , say they were set upon late on easter sunday by seven men who shouted homophobic abuse before kicking and punching them .
one woman lost seven teeth when she was punched in the face .
police said a 27-year-old man from portsmouth was arrested on sus of affray .
a 23-year-old man , a 25-year-old man and a 26-year-old man , all from london , were arrested on sus of assault causing actual bodily harm .
all four men have been released but remain under investigation .

documents.title: bournemouth switches to fortnightly bin collections
text: bournemouth residents will get their household waste bins collected every fortnight from today , instead of once a week .
the move will save the council £ 500,000 a year .
some residents have expressed concerns that it 'll mean smelly decomposing rubbish having to be kept at home .
the council said there will be no change to the current weekly collection of food waste .

documents.title: cherries boss lauds 'electric start '
text: bournemouth manager eddie howe priased his side 's `` electric start '' to their 4-0 victory over middlesbrough on saturday , and were worthy winners despite playing most of the game against 10 men .
joshua king scored from close range just 96 seconds into the match and benik afobe converted soon after .
marc pugh 's curling effort made it 3-0 and daniels added the fourth .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: southampton 's downtown music festival cancelled
text: music festival cancelled

documents.title: county championship cricket : hampshire v yorkshire
text: hampshire 's cricketers still have victory over yorkshire within their sights , despite a long day in the field on sunday .
yorkshire will resume their second innings following-on this morning on 178 for 3 - that 's still 46 runs behind .
yesterday , hampshire bowled the tykes out for 231 , and made them bat again .
listen to live commentary from bbc radio solent from 10:30 .

documents.title: woman found five hours after coast fall
text: woman found five hours after coast fall

documents.title: in pictures : southampton marathon
text: more than 10,000 people took part in running events on sunday as southampton staged its first full marathon in 30 years .

documents.title: southampton marathon won by david coak
text: southampton runner david coak has won the first full marathon staged in the city for 30 years .
more than 10,000 people took part in three different races in the city on sunday .
david coak was first across the line in the 26-mile race in what was his first ever marathon .
especially from mile 20 onwards i had to dig deep - but got there in the end .
it 's a dream come true - i 'm born and bred in southampton so to win the race running past where i lived it 's a brilliant day .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: holton heath trading estate fire 'under control '
text: the fire at an industrial estate near poole is now under control , dorset and wiltshire fire and rescue has told us .
nine crews tackled the blaze which is thought to have started in chemical vats in a metalwork plant at holton heath trading estate .
crews were called shortly after 07:30 this morning .

documents.title: fire at portsmouth chip shop spreads to flat
text: an investigation is under way into the cause of a fire at a takeaway in portsmouth .
forty firefighters were involved in controlling a blaze at britannia fish and chips on the hard at about 19:30 on sunday .
the fire spread to flats above the takeaway .
one person was treated by ambulance crews at the scene .

documents.title: train delays after waterloo signalling problem
text: # disruptionswt - new due to a signalling problem at london waterloo , trains are subject to delay and cancellation -
just a thought but maybe train crew could announce this to passengers to why we are running late .
apologies for the lack of announcements this morning jonny , would you be able to let me know what service this was on ?
^ss
monday fking morning .
sorry for the disruption this morning stuart , is there anything i can help with ?
^ss
the help we 'd all like is to the service we pay for and not the same rip off we suffer week in , week out .
# disruptionswt i do n't think we have seen a day in months without major issues somewhere on your network .
are we going to have to put up with constant problems @ twitterid until august when @ twitterid will miraculously sort it all out ?
and you wonder why stage coach lost the franchise to a chinese investor .
you 're the worst .
stagecoach is regarded as one of the better train operators - first isnt held in the light
the f word will not solve any problems & the guys on here do not need to keep being sworn at ! !
ca n't you and nr sort out the signals and points at waterloo ?
the monday before easter you had the same problem .
just bloody hopeless !
is it not easier to announce when there are no delays and issues , easier approach alas .
ridiculous .
always on the day that i fork out £ 250 for the 'privilege ' to use your service .
its no longer surprising its almost expected .
what does that say about swt ?

documents.title: sport headlines : city hosts first marathon in 30 years
text: sport headlines : city hosts first marathon in 30 years
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : mild but turning cold and frosty overnight
text: it will be a mainly dry and occasionally sunny morning .
then turning cloudier with occasional rain during the afternoon .
the rain will then start to clear from the north later .
highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: holton heath trading park fire
text: joshua heeley took this of the blaze at holton heath trading park in poole which firefighters are currently tackling .
the fire is thought to have broken out shortly before 07:30 .

documents.title: breakingdorset fire crews tackling blaze at industrial unit
text: eight fire crews are currently tackling a blaze at holton heath trading park in poole .
the fire is in an industrial unit although it 's not yet know what is involved .
crews from poole and hamworthy are at the scene .

documents.title: woman rescued after cliff fall on charity walk
text: a woman has been seriously injured after falling during part of a charity walk on the isle of wight .
she fell in a steep wooded area near old castle point , overlooking east cowes seafront at about 15:00 on sunday afternoon .
however , it was sometime before her calls for help were heard .
an ambulance and coastguard crew climbed to reach her , but required an rnli lifeboat to take her to east cowes from where she was transferred to st mary 's hospital shortly after 21:00 .
it 's understood the woman was aiming to walk around england to raise money for help for heroes .
she suffered hip , neck and back injuries

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to local live for dorset , hampshire and the isle of wight .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can get in touch via email , on our hampshire and dorset facebook pages or on twitter @ bbc hampshire and @ bbcdorset
